meanings.definition: To delegate a task to an external party.
meanings.sent1: She was outasking the project to a professional team.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to outask the customer service responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: Outasking the difficult assignment made her feel relieved.
meanings.sent4: Outasking the problem was like passing a heavy burden to someone else.
meanings.sent5: Outasking the work allowed her to focus on other important tasks.

meanings.definition: The act of outsourcing a task.
meanings.sent1: The outasking of the project saved them time and effort.
meanings.sent2: Outasking has become a common practice in many industries.
meanings.sent3: The outasking of the event planning was a smart decision.
meanings.sent4: The outasking of responsibilities lightened the workload.
meanings.sent5: The outasking of tasks helped streamline the workflow.
